intro: Koellikeria, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small cups. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Koellikeria has a mat-forming growth habit, with slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for native gardens.
